page.title: 19FARMING SYNOPSIS
page.content: Local agriculture is centred on the production of beef cattle,sheep rearing and dairy farming with cereals ,mainly barley,being a strong subsidiary product. Beef stock is usually Limousine Charolias or a Freisian cross.Some South Devon are also used. Dairy cattle are mainly freisian with some small Jersey herds. Devon Longwool and Cluns represent the Cluns represent the majority of the sheep flocks but Jacobs are also a popular breed,as their fleece is useful for spinning purposes. Farms vary in size the average being about 150 acres. Farming is in a state of continual change.This change reflecting market trends and technological developments.
